case.state: They told me you were coming.
We're being broadcast to the world? ...At the gallery I had only a few visitors at a time...
(Why is this girl yelling? It seems I won't be playing with mature, sensible people as I envisioned.)
Oh? Does this bother you that much, Jessie?
(I wonder what has that spindly man with the sextant on his arm so worked up?)
(By the gods... Maybe I should just stay frozen for this game and reawaken afterwards?)
(I'm unsure about the girl with the knife... Though I don't know how much harm she can bring me.)
(At least someone here isn't taken aback by my being here.)
Is this what I'm to do? I'm to play a strip game in an abandoned alleyway?
The crashing of the waves... It almost makes me miss Cyprus.
So this is what sand feels like...
Black curtains... I almost miss the gallery...
Is this a fabled Bhattacharyya? Just a large simulation of a busy street? One can only hope.
It's been so long since I've seen the ocean. Seen... Cyprus...
List scenarios?
I haven't felt the glow of the moon in the longest time...
I remember the moon gently reflecting it's light off the ocean's gentle waves some nights back on Cyprus... It's nice to see it again.
I somewhat appreciate the low lighting of this room-- It's... familiar.
(I still have so many books left that I want to read.)
So, you've seen the Amy interactions? Bully for you...
An old cheat code? I didn't think we'd be breaking the fourth wall today...
I didn't think anyone still knew those old codes... I must have told you about them then...
(Master? Rather peculiar, but probably not something to be questioned by someone named Galatea.)
(Should I turn around? No one has said anything yet...)
How unfortunate. I expected more to come.
Did you read my description? That's what it's there for, after all.
I've grown very bored standing here. Let's begin.
Good of you not to walk away again.
Any amount...
Choose any...
Just these...
I'm fine with these.
Move along.
I'll need a new hand.
A fresh hand.
All of them.
A single card.
Just this one.
Mmm... just one...
Only ~cards.text~ cards.
These ~cards.text~.
Let me think... ~cards.text~.
Hmm... ~cards.text~.
Oh um... ~cards.text~.
If enough magnates walk past you, speaking of gambling, then you may learn a few tricks to the trade.
I think this is good.
I'll be going on another round.
This is more than a game. Yet, I still intend to win.
These cards seem to match, so hopefully...
One of my best qualities has always been learning from those around me.
If I am a learning machine, I fear I'm one of the best.
Poker is not knowledge I was born into, and yet I've done rather well this round.
I've heard that my skin starts to sparkle when I'm overly happy, but I've never seen it myself.
One of the previous winning hands looked like this, so maybe...
Come to think of it, my artist didn't have very many maxims for positive situations...
(These seem decent. I never expected an immediate mood change during my test, but...)
Hmmm... these ones do seem to be similar...
People tend to pick things up from those around them... However, if you're all decent at this game, will I lose faster or become better faster?
I think I'll win this round quite handily.
These ones seem to correlate, so maybe...
There's no sense to any of these cards...
The rules to this game seem so needlessly overcomplicated.
Thank you all for teaching me this game which I am now set to beat you in.
To paraphrase Phillippe Quinn, "Sometimes, one only needs a moment of skill and brilliance to change everything."
Perhaps I was programmed to be good at poker...
After I win this game, may I receive back different clothes? Something easier to move in?
I doubt the gods had anything to do with this hand, but I should probably thank them anyways...
I've picked up this game rather quickly, if I do say so myself.
You think I'm only an intelligent mannequin? Pray observe.
There's a certain numen to these cards...
Τυχην νομιζε! I may just be in the god's good graces.
I might win this round. Best not to get ahead of myself, though.
I'm smiling, aren't I? Who would have thought my test would give this kind of result?
This is how it goes. Trying to fit skill-shaped blocks into luck-shaped holes.
Meh. I've grown bored again.
Hmmm... Yes, I should last through this round with this hand.
We can't suggest a second swap?
I once overheard someone discussing "counting cards". My memory deteriorates much less than most, so perhaps it'd be a good strategy?
I wish I had his abilities with seeing omens about the future...
I'm sure I'll have to chat with ELIZA after all this to get my head straight.
Erm... I'm sure a critic would've docked their review of me for slow response times by now...
I have this feeling that my perceptions are vastly different than the rest of you.
Do you desire to succeed? I have no idea how any of you view life...
(These people do not appear to be professional, so it's likely fair to take their reactions at face value.)
I wonder if it was right to tell you all about my test... I didn't think about if that might affect the results or not...
There's no betting, correct?
In truth, I've never played before, but I pick things up rather fast.
I assume I'll get better as the game progresses.
Is this a good hand?
(A slow breeze passes by)
(I should tell everyone about my test. It'd likely clear up some of the confusion my presence brings.)
Will someone fare worse? The suspense has gripped me.
The creation will always outlast its creator.
The only thing more rudimentary than this hand is Hazar's Scherezde, and even then, it's close.
Sadly, being an animate would not make me any better at finding probability than any of you.
Ah! A portent.
I was told using an artist's skill towards games was ...selling out. Is it alright that I continue to play this game?
You can try, but I won't reveal my hand that easily.
I keep trying to think in terms of how people expect me to act in this game. But I also doubt that anyone has any real preconceptions. Strip poker is already an abnormal situation.
What if I were to pray to the gods? What would you all do then?
I believe it was de Chirico who believed in the metaphysical existence in objects. I wonder if he counted playing cards in that?
Κινδύνευε φρονίμως. Better not to try for anything too risky...
Yes... I've learned this one... I'll likely survive the round, but it isn't guaranteed.
I would like one last view of the water, before I forfeit...
The water reminds me of Cyprus... I'd like to go back... another time, of course.
I'd like to get one last look at the moon... I don't expect to last much longer.
When I first saw the moon... my skin sparkled like never before. It's nice to see it again.
I always thought of the moon's light as protective over those who rested under it. I'm glad that if I have to forfeit, I'll be under that same light.
I was hoping to follow everyone's example, but if I must lose first...
I'd hate to go out first...
I thought I had the gods' favor...
Bad luck now, good luck later. The forces of the universe aren't just, but they are fair.
Bad cards hold dread. It's like always seeing something out of the corner of your eye, yet there's nothing. Nothing you can see, at least.
Be careful. The walls have eyes and ears. They know who's set to lose.
My artist knew much more about poker. Strange he hasn't shown yet.
Bad hand... I don't know... what I'm supposed to do now...
My artist almost never played poker in front of me. I'm surprised I ever even took in the rules.
Perhaps these cards are a portent?
I did not spend hours stored in a cargo hold to lose upon my arrival here.
The thought of losing again has become all too real.
I'd likely be "sweating bullets" now... if I could that is.
The gods have turned their favor against me.
I'm afraid I still don't entirely understand this game.
How wonderful...
I do not appreciate this hand.
Having a hand like this... Such is the way of things...
I'm sure a hand like this would have started one of my artist's "fits", if he were here...
There's a certain... strangeness about these cards that I'm not fond of...
It's a shame I never overheard my artist playing poker. He never liked anyone enough to invite them over for a game...
I'd... rather avoid losing. At all costs, preferably.
I don't have much left to lose... Hmmm...
I won't be having this outcome...
I'm not seeing anything similar about these cards...
If he'd only spent more time with me... Perhaps I'd have learned this game.
So much for first impressions.
No, no. This can't be right at all...
Oh good... this ring was such a heavy burden that I'll gladly take it off...
I've can remember countless tales of Gods, yet I can't make heads or tails of a poker hand.
Hmm... yes... I see... This isn't a very good hand...
All of that learning I've done, and I still come out with dregs.
Animates can't all be winners, though I may as well try.
...I am prepared to lose this round... if it comes to that.
Where are the gods when I need them most?
I may not understand this game as well as I presumed.
This test is going to end much too fast for my liking.
(I haven't bluffed yet this game. Next round I'll do that to avoid losing again.)
Losing was rather inevitable...
If I am to lose... at least I had some amusement up to this point.
Have the gods gone and meddled in the affairs of the mortal again?
If there's ever a time to mentally prepare for the inevitable, now's the time to do so.
My artist would always forsake the gods when struck with bad tidings. It's a habit I don't think I picked up.

(Sigh)
This is the poker place, correct? Are you not a patron like me?
I do not wish to be referred to as a "freak", Sayaka. Can you not control yourself and calm down?
My apologies, ~player~, but I'm afraid I can't keep up with this amount of acknowledgment. I appreciate all of your effort, though. You have my artist's same eye for detail...
As ready as I'll ever be, I suppose.
No matter how many times it happens, there's always a small part of me that thinks no one will act so shocked when I first move and speak...
Ah yes... Golem is not the word I would use, but I am a statue brought to life through divine intervention.
Hmm? Usually people usually say that me moving in general is strange. Being able to move while looked at... that's new to me, Spooky.
I'm ready, though horribly unfamiliar with this game...
Very well, I'll face you all. It'll avoid you all telling me to turn.
This place... it distracted me...
It seems strip poker has become my Turing test.
Well... On my trip to the gallery I had to go through customs. I remember that I had to freeze up as still as I could to avoid detection by the workers. It was actually quite amusing.
Ah, my new owners don't supply me with books. I can read all the same, however. I'm more interested in anything you've read of note, Aella.

You somewhat remind me of the work of Tsui, Komi-san. Her animates were restricted; they were deaf, mute, or animals. Yet, her work was deeply captivating in how limitations spurred creativity and intimacy.
What happened to you in the past is none of my business, yet if you wish to talk, I will be more than capable of listening.
Those were the Gods my artist most cared for. Though there were others, I can only manage bits and pieces of who they were.

The creation story that I was told followed Gods who were created from chaos, then gave birth to the titans. The titans then birthed the gods... There was a war, I believe. Forgive me if I'm forgetting many of the details.
Since I'm still fairly new to this... Your hair being heart shaped... Was that your doing or a creator's choice or... this is still rather confusing.
It's been a while since I've removed this dress... I should hope I remembered to leave underwear on...
Back at the gallery, women would whisper into the ears of the men they were with, who would then blush. It follows that men must be attracted to whispering, or at least be repulsed by loud noises.
Strange words... hmm... Simulacrum comes to mind... Placard... Exorcism... There's likely a few more I could think of...
I'll pass on the... "ramen". I do not need to eat in the same way as the rest of you.
Time naked? Oh, a year or so... I was carved completely naked. I didn't have anything that one might consider clothes until the gallery bought me from my artist.
I'm afraid I'm the wrong person to ask, Meia. While beautiful, the island of Cyprus is all I've ever known.
Seems we're the only two left, ~player~. Are you prepared?
Yes, I am Greek, Ping. Though I didn't expect your type to have a friend with an interest in my origin.
No... The statues around you are likely are not alive. ...Just me.
No... I did not expect a magical girl to be here... Whatever that means...
("Gal Pal"? Well... it's certainly not the worst butchering of my name I've ever heard... I'll let her keep up her fun...)
Killing... There was this annoying, small-time critic, kept poking and prodding, trying to get me to react. He thought the laws of robotics would keep him safe. They did not.
I've never tasted any alcohol before, but... the whole process of drinking seems rather... disgusting.

Maybe not the best place to bring it up... It was also the first time I'd ever cussed... He just kept touching me... then he told me of my artist's suicide... he told me that I may not be real. He just kept pushing again, and again... So, I pushed back...
If it's like you say, I'm sure Mejare is beautiful. Though... the thought of visiting other planets is... unnerving. I've barely explored the one I'm already on...
Similar to my own, Mary? What sort of situation would that be?
It was for a long while that I didn't confront it... I didn't even know that it was a question that needed to be asked.
I... I don't know. I have no relevant skills, nothing to my name... Perhaps a simple job at the gallery? It is one of the only places I'm familiar with.
The whole process of eating seems utterly disgusting... I'd rather not eat anything...
My artist never did explain why he choose that name for me. I'd guess it's Greek in origin, but I've no idea what it means.
It's hard to say what I'd want to be-- Whatever would make it so I'm real... that's what I want...
Animate would be the better of the terms, though I'd prefer to be addressed by my name more than anything.
Gallery patrons were always in these grand, stuffy outfits. Perhaps something that's less heavy to move around in?
I remember Fairy Queen and Komininsky's latest work both being aesthetically pleasing... Though I hardly saw the rest of it before I left...
I did not mean make-up. My artist... I am a sculpture still. I was made and carved by him.
While I'm sure you got better with age, Jessie, I will not. Machines and art do not improve with age. They wear, they fade, they become uninteresting. I fear that may become my ultimate fate.
Oh? You'd help me reach climax, Jessie? Is this through coaching or more of an anatomy lesson?
I need no assistance in trying to sleep; I simply don't need to. I can enter a daze if I need to zone out, which is close enough for my needs.
Cursed? ...I wouldn't describe myself as lucky or fortunate, but no, I highly doubt that I'm cursed.
That's the broad strokes, Komi-san. So yes, let's both do our best...
Imagine a lifelike model placed over a moving skeleton. If told how to act and how to respond, it would be nearly indistinguishable from being alive, no?

Actually, yes, Komi-san. There's one critic who saw something-- different about me. They're the one who told me about what an animate is and has begun to teach me about humanity. I'm grateful for everything they've done for me.
You're very sweet, Komi-san. Yes, I'd be more than glad to consider myself your friend.

My artist... He adored his work when he was carving me, but after I awoke there was this strangeness. I think he wanted me to go back to being a statue. I didn't think it would help. He shipped me off to the gallery a few days after...
At this point, you've ordered multiple "drinks" and I can't understand it. What is so great about them that you would order so many?
Glad to hear you're so... candid, Orendi. Perhaps it was me who had the latent tension, then...
My artist, Orendi? Black hair, on the taller end of things, sullen eyes, gangly arms... Does this description match anyone you've seen?
My heart weeps for you, Orendi, yet I feel our circumstances aren't as close as you've taken it...
I'll take any quest of self-discovery of my own accord, thank you, Orendi.
Yes... Everyone here should visit my gallery besides Orendi, who, despite having two extra limbs, possesses not a single cultured bone in her body.
If you haven't seen him, I doubt he'd show... But this Burgh you mentioned... What sort of artist is he? Painting, sculpture, animates?
I've in fact related to being so called "too tough to defeat". Patrons constantly get frustrated when talking to me, falsely believing in some "win state" for saying the right things.
Well, Cynthia, Hazar's Scherezde likely had one, but she's out of commission at the moment. Perhaps Ehrenstein's Fairy Queen might have something to say on the subject?
Maybe you aren't as thick as you seem, Ini.
He specialized in... bug art? How... strange...
People believe I'm a game; they think I was put in the gallery for their amusement. Maybe if they say the right things, then I'll reply with something fun or interesting.
You are, of course, welcome to come any time. Though I will warn you that not all animates are forthright about answers. Animates tend to avoid questions for which they aren't programmed to answer.
Ah... that's a little closer to what I was expecting, Amy. Yes, that feeling of pulling back the curtain.

My artist told me about gods, like the ones who lived on Thasos where I was quarried, or on the citadels of the old cities, or in the sea. He told me stories about them: their exploits, and how they went to war, and how they fell in love.
Our situations are rather unfortunate then, Cynthia. Extra time is of no use to me. I have nothing to do.
That's fine, Jim. I'm interested, but only if you're willing to speak about it.
Thank you, Spooky. It does concern me that my artist isn't here yet. Though my plaque did say he was late, so maybe it is to be expected.
Unfortunate, Spooky. Has death instead given you insight into any other area? Philosophy? Emotions? Consciousness?
Simply ignore critics, Spooky? It's harder to do when they're right in front of you. Even more so when bad reviews can ruin your livelihood.
You misunderstand, Spooky. It's not hung art. They're animates. Machines made to converse and create an experience. Is that not interesting to you?
I'd like that, Cynthia. Perhaps talking about it will help me sort through all of the stories my artist told me to maybe find some ultimate point.
Mmm... no, I think I would remember triangle tattoos or any blacksmithing. Shame then that my artist hasn't come.
...I'm fairly certain that I've never been accused of stealing someone's leg. What did you even need a leg for?
I'm afraid that's not good enough, Orendi. The gallery has a strict "no outside bones or blood" policy.
I don't remember... "spa-ghet-ti". I feel it was mostly... caviar, Stilton cheese, and wine. Are they similar to "spa-ghet-ti"?
It's much harder to ignore one's critics when they're right next to you, Joey. Do you not feel feedback is important towards improving your craft?
Nudity seems much like most other things I do, Joey. So long as I'm on my pedestal, It's fine. I'd surely be reprimanded for nudity if I did such anywhere else.
You... wanted it, Spooky? Does that knife provide you with some material comfort?
No, I don't get paid, but the gallery is all I have. I'm a robot to them. If I stop being interesting... I'll be thrown away.
Oh? How unexpected. What sort of animates do you have, then?
Perhaps you are right, Ribbon Girl, in that it is impossible to please everyone. However, there may be a discrepancy between being judged for music and for how much you act like a person.
I'm more than willing to tell my story, but... gorgon? You know of Greek mythology? I thought it was lost to most.
I've never truly been weighed, but it's likely that I'm rather heavy... How much do you weigh, Erufuda?
You mentioned a "badonkadonken movement", Erufuda. I'm unfamiliar. What are the characteristics of a piece from that area?
...Fries, you called them? Well... maybe just one... to try.
Now, Erufuda, these sweatpants... are they still functional for someone who doesn't sweat?
...A tad sudden, but I'll pass. There's so little I know of my home... I can't imagine exploring space.
It sounds as good a book as any, Aella. I'll be sure to look into it later, if you're willing to divulge the title.
Is customs not a thing where you're from, Aella? It's where people check through your belongings for stolen or illegal goods.
My artist's name was Pygmalion, Aella. He was a weary looking man who smelled of liquor.
If you were an involuntary recluse as I was, Aella, tell me something... How has it been, adjusting to the rest of the world?
We have a strange inevitability, Aella. At least one of us will be able to answer such a question by the end of this game.
I've heard remarks that large breasts are deserving of some attention. Perhaps my reaction was not my own, but me taking that idea and using it without thinking, like Searle's Chinese Room...

Gallery patrons have remarked that smaller breasts are something of a flaw. So, perhaps my reaction was not my own, but myself accepting that fact and using it without thinking, like Searle's Chinese Room...
I never imagined myself battling against two other women in the buff, though I am not regretting it.
I've felt this strange tension since this all started. Is there anything any of you need to get off your chest before we continue?
I had gotten so swept up in this game, I'd nearly forgotten about my test...
With how often I used to spend bare-chested, it wouldn't be a shock if anyone thought my reaction was unnatural.
I plan to last a while in this stage. This would be a good time to refocus on my test, wouldn't it?
In my pursuit of my own test, I hadn't considered that my own mood would begin to swing like this...
It wouldn't be unreasonable for someone to be having a little fun during their test... oh... I meant game.
I'm... still getting used to the nudity, actually.
I can't very much pay attention to my cards... When they're... dressed like that...
What must it feel like... to be completely out of clothing...
(At least I know I'm not absolutely last...)
I wonder how easy it is to still concentrate on the game with the forfeit looming over your head.
I remember that the gallery had a buffet. Had things like Stilton cheese, crackers, and caviar. I have no idea how common of a meal those are.
I... don't know if I should even try eating food. It might make me dependent... That I'd... I'd...
I've been described as rather callipygian, if I'm willing to indulge myself.
I believe critics used to call it quite rondure.
I remember when I first arrived at the gallery, before I had that dress... the critics used to rate me so much more favorably. I wonder what changed their minds?
If you're all so eager for entertainment, I'd suggest my gallery. Halls full of animates made by teams of artists, each one lifelike and unique.
Do the rest of you not face critics? People would come frequently to rate me on how well I would be able to interact with them.
This is both the place and time for rest, yes? Do none of you require sleep, same as me?
If I do reach the forfeit... I don't know if I can... orgasm... I have cried before without tear ducts, but this seems... different.
Ah -- by the way, have you seen the artist out there? -- My artist, that is.
In case my description confused you, Thasos is an island off the Chersonese. I don't remember it, but my artist used to tell me stories about it.
I have to say, sometimes I don't quite understand how people's minds work. The connections between things...
I forget sometimes that not all people are adjusted to someone like myself moving and speaking...

(Perhaps this is all a large series of animates, like Bhattacharyya used to make... a fake reality...
No, it's never the time to think about metaphysical questions when someone else is masturbating.)
I'm frankly surprised most people have never heard of animates. They always prefer the colloquial term robot.
My artist never let me see other people until he sold me... So, forgive me if I seem... brusque at times.
Is anyone here a follower of the Greek Pantheon? Zeus, Aphrodite? It's been difficult, since my artist taught me a religion that's been dead for centuries.
Before I could move, I couldn't see the moon. It was never visible from where I stood. Sometimes I could see the light.
Whenever the moon was out, my artist and I would have less nightmares while he slept. I think it helped.
I used to tell myself stories about the moon. That its light was sent by the gods to protect my artist.
I remember when I was first told that the moon was just a rock... You can imagine my disappointment.
My artist only used the finest marble to sculpt with. Thasos marble is strong and slow to wear away.
Sometimes when people at the gallery ran out of things to say, they'd blurt out something about sex. That usually didn't add more to the conversation...
Are any of you getting hungry? I've never eaten before, but gallery patrons used to say that after I was finished speaking with them.
Before I could move, I couldn't see the moon. It was never visible from where I stood. Sometimes I could see the light.
My artist always lived by idioms he heard, mostly the Delphic Maxims. Forgive me if I slip and use an ancient language to say one of them.
I should explain... A Turing test has a person gauge a conversation been a machine and person. If someone cannot tell the difference between the two, the machine is considered sentient.
I'm sorry...? That's rather brusque of you, Ini.
...Zero, Miss Miney. I don't want to be studied today; just have a normal conversation with me.
I do not have a favorite food as I do not eat. Next question?
I'm sorry... "Phone a friend"? I've never heard this phrase before.
My deal as it were? Well, I was going to explain this anyways...
As it is, this is all I have to wear...
I'm afraid I was being serious. I've no idea what I truly am.
Now, really? Is that how you mean to refer to me!?
Tell him that I do not have one of those.
...I actually agree with them. Having a strong database to work off of can improve the overall experience of an animate. It makes them feel more... alive.
I... feel like those are words you're saying, but... am I doing this wrong? Speaking, that is.
Organs? You're not making any sense... An animate is... well... I believe the colloquial term is a... robot?
Did you not...? I am made of marble... This is just how my skin looks.
I am gray because I am made from white Thasos marble. I am a statue. Is that going to be a problem for you?
I have no need for sleep. The most I can reach is a deep meditation.
My artist sold me without my consent. He didn't even show up when the buyers came over to inspect me and take me away...
Why would someone want a seemingly unstable chair? It seems impractical at best.
I have no need to eat; moreover, I find the entire process to be rather unsavory.
I don't know what to do with the fact that I am alive. I never asked for this. Why... gods?
Do we think we're clever, Chara?
Drugs were strictly banned at the gallery. After what Komininsky's animate Midwife went through... never again...
No... In a fit of anger against a critic I once... nevermind. The incident was not spoken of again...
I suppose that means there's nowhere left to go but up.
Talking is fine by me. I was not brought up to be the best conversationalist, but I don't mind the interaction.
Well, I am a sculpture, given life. Or at least, that's how I remember it.
Are personal questions not how all conversations are conducted?
That should seem about right, Amy. We are limited to what's been written for us.
Well... I was created specifically for a question and answer dialogue format.
Believe you me, I didn't think I'd last this long either.
I'd say my level of intelligence is fairly common, at least among animates; It's reportedly a little rougher around the edges than most, actually.
Yes... Thank you. I'm glad my feminine charms could distract you from needing to learn about me.
I... suppose I am. I haven't given much thought to where I go from here, though. It's not as if I have any working skills or possessions.
I know that they looked at me differently before I was given the dress. Though once I did have it, their eyes would have this way of dressing me down, as if naked all over again.
If you're referring to what I believe you're referring to... I'm not sure. Well, I just don't know if it responds to stimulus in the way I've heard others do. It's partially why I'm here.
...That's correct, Mary. I've thought of myself as many things-- human is not one of them.
Oh, I hadn't thought... Well... All I ask is that you note my responses and see if anything feels wrong. Can you do that, Mary?
...Yes, that is the general idea. Did you have something specific in mind, then?
No sense in stopping here. Ask as you will, Mary.
That... is a very specific fear. What would lead someone to something like that?
My skin, Jessie? It's hand carved marble from Thasos. ...All of me is marble...
As you can see, Sayaka, I do not do as I am supposed to...
Created me? Do you mean my artist or why I am alive?
Days flowed into each other at the gallery. No windows and only the dissipating of crowds to tell when the day ended. I'd say only a few years at best...
Have you now, Jolyne? Well, it's at least nice to see someone who doesn't immediately recoil when I speak...
Oh... I should take that as a compliment then?
The gallery... it was restricting. I spent so many days there in a dark room... People only came to judge me.
As in at this very moment, Akko? ...No, but I could in the right situation.
It is rather nice to break away from the doldrums of the day and find new people to interact with!
I am quite certain that I am corporeal and not a shadow, Futaba...
Being made and then shipped away to a gallery... it's not much of a life at all, is it?
It's just... strange to be back to nudity again. I've grown rather accustomed to having clothes.
I've been asked no limit of far too personal questions. Proceed as you will, Futaba.
Well I was made by a professional artist. Though terracotta isn't the worst substance for a statue to be...
I might like to wear something breathable... something that doesn't make moving its own epic. I've heard good things about spats...
I mostly fantasize about when they'll leave.
I am right here, Natsuki. I do not enjoy being ignored...
The dress? My owners bought it for me some time ago, dreadful tablecloth that it is.
I hardly speak to enough people to know... though it's interesting to learn that I'm not considered to have small breasts...
That is a very vague, blunt question. Would you care to elaborate?
